title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description:
An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design: 

<parameters>
  <scalar parameter name='dateParam1'>
    <property name='dataType'>dateTime</property>
    <property name='allowBlank'>false</property>
    <property name='format'>Unformatted</property>
    <property name='controlType'>textbox</property>
    <expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalar parameter>
</parameters>

There are two problems here:

1. The model should have stored a 'dateTime' type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss), which is locale independent, to ensure portability.
OB:
When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design:

<parameters>
  <scalar parameter name='dateParam1'>
    <property name='dataType'>dateTime</property>
    <property name='allowBlank'>false</property>
    <property name='format'>Unformatted</property>
    <property name='controlType'>textbox</property>
    <expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalar parameter>
</parameters>
EB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value should be rejected and an error message should be displayed. The report design should not show the invalid date string in the parameter definition.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter.
3. Set the parameter type as 'DateTime'.
4. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report design.
6. Check the parameter definition in the report design.

Expected Result: The invalid date string should be rejected and an error message should be displayed. The report design should not show the invalid date string in the parameter definition.
